channel.title: "Impossible fix error"
channel.description:
[code]Starting... [1/23/12 12:18 PM]: Launching InsidiaX... [1/23/12 12:18 PM]: Exception in thread "main" [1/23/12 12:18 PM]: java.io.IOException: Unable to establish loopback connection [1/23/12 12:18 PM]: at sun.nio.ch.PipeImpl$Initializer.run(Unknown Source) [1/23/12 12:18 PM]: at sun.nio.ch.PipeImpl$Initializer.run(Unknown Source) [1/23/12 12:18 PM]: at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) [1/23/12 12:18 PM]: at sun.nio.ch.PipeImpl.<init>(Unknown Source) [1/23/12 12:18 PM]: at sun.nio.ch.SelectorProviderImpl.openPipe(Unknown Source) [1/23/12 12:18 PM]: at java.nio.channels.Pipe.open(Unknown Source) [1/23/12 12:18 PM]: at sun.nio.ch.WindowsSelectorImpl.<init>(Unknown Source)
[1/23/12 12:18 PM]: at sun.nio.ch.WindowsSelectorProvider.openSelector(Unknown Source) [1/23/12 12:18 PM]: at java.nio.channels.Selector.open(Unknown Source) [1/23/12 12:18 PM]: at org.apache.mina.transport.socket.nio.SocketAcceptor.startupWorker(SocketAcceptor.java:162) [1/23/12 12:18 PM]: at org.apache.mina.transport.socket.nio.SocketAcceptor.bind(SocketAcceptor.java:141) [1/23/12 12:18 PM]: at server.Server.main(Server.java:154) [1/23/12 12:18 PM]: Caused by: java.net.BindException: Cannot assign requested address: bind [1/23/12 12:18 PM]: at sun.nio.ch.Net.bind0(Native Method) [1/23/12 12:18 PM]: at sun.nio.ch.Net.bind(Unknown Source) [1/23/12 12:18 PM]: at sun.nio.ch.Net.bind(Unknown Source) [1/23/12 12:18 PM]: at sun.nio.ch.ServerSocketChannelImpl.bind(Unknown Source) [1/23/12 12:18 PM]: at sun.nio.ch.ServerSocketAdaptor.bind(Unknown Source) [1/23/12 12:18 PM]: at sun.nio.ch.ServerSocketAdaptor.bind(Unknown Source) [1/23/12 12:18 PM]: ... 12 more Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
Has anyone had this problem before? I've literally had like 5 people (experienced rsps coders) try and help me but none can find a solution.
The loopback connection error is what I can't resolve.
Also, on various sources I get an error like "Unable to establish connection on port 43594" (same error code)
If you know of ANYTHING that might work please post below or add me on Skype.
EvilDevilDemented
Cheers!

item.title: "Impossible fix error"
item.dc:creator: @dementedd dementedd
item.description:
@dementedd wrote:

Yes I do. Check that second Gyazo link to see all my IPv’s and what not.

Do you have IPv4…

item.title: "Impossible fix error"
item.dc:creator: @dementedd dementedd
item.description:
@dementedd wrote:

Does this little “X” by my localhost connection mean it doesn’t work?

And I have IPv6.

Gyazo

Gyazo

​

Read full topic

item.title: "Impossible fix error"
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

From google:

This means something about your localhost loopback is either misconfigured (such as reporting as a non loopback IP address), or being prevented from being used by something (most common cause being microsoft windows policy decisions and firewall rules).

Less common is a machine that does not have IPv4 available (only IPv6).

Read full topic

item.description:
